article.headline: George Mason 81, Radford 55
article.story: FAIRFAX, Va. -- Cam Long scored 20 points as George Mason jumped on Radford early and cruised to an 81-55 win on Wednesday night. Andre Cornelius added 17 points and Ryan Pearson had 13 as the Patriots (3-2) snapped a two-game losing streak and avenged an 80-53 road loss to the Highlanders (2-2) last year. The Patriots jumped out to a 43-23 halftime lead and continued their hot shooting in the second half, finishing at 55 percent from the field for the game. They made 13 3-pointers, the most since they hit the same number against UNC-Wilmington on Jan. 3, 2008. Radford shot 38 percent from the field. Luke Hancock, George Mason's leading scorer entering the game at 15 points a game, was held to five points, but handed out 10 assists and had eight rebounds. Evan Faulkner led Radford with 15 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
